00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_refs_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_refs_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 
00032 /**
00033  * @file git2/refs.h
00034  * @brief Git reference management routines
00035  * @defgroup git_reference Git reference management routines
00036  * @ingroup Git
00037  * @{
00038  */
00039 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00040 
00041 /**
00042  * Lookup a reference by its name in a repository.
00043  *
00044  * The generated reference is owned by the repository and
00045  * should not be freed by the user.
00046  *
00047  * @param reference_out pointer to the looked-up reference
00048  * @param repo the repository to look up the reference
00049  * @param name the long name for the reference (e.g. HEAD, ref/heads/master, refs/tags/v0.1.0, ...)
00050  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00051  */
00052 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_lookup(git_reference **reference_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name);
00053 
00054 /**
00055  * Create a new symbolic reference.
00056  *
00057  * The reference will be created in the repository and written
00058  * to the disk.
00059  *
00060  * This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
00061  * be free'd by the user.
00062  *
00063  * @param ref_out Pointer to the newly created reference
00064  * @param repo Repository where that reference will live
00065  * @param name The name of the reference
00066  * @param target The target of the reference
00067  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00068  */
00069 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_create_symbolic(git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const char *target);
00070 
00071 /**
00072  * Create a new object id reference.
00073  *
00074  * The reference will be created in the repository and written
00075  * to the disk.
00076  *
00077  * This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
00078  * be free'd by the user.
00079  *
00080  * @param ref_out Pointer to the newly created reference
00081  * @param repo Repository where that reference will live
00082  * @param name The name of the reference
00083  * @param id The object id pointed to by the reference.
00084  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00085  */
00086 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_create_oid(git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const git_oid *id);
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * Get the OID pointed to by a reference.
00090  * 
00091  * Only available if the reference is direct (i.e. not symbolic)
00092  *
00093  * @param ref The reference
00094  * @return a pointer to the oid if available, NULL otherwise
00095  */
00096 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_reference_oid(git_reference *ref);
00097 
00098 /**
00099  * Get full name to the reference pointed by this reference
00100  * 
00101  * Only available if the reference is symbolic
00102  *
00103  * @param ref The reference
00104  * @return a pointer to the name if available, NULL otherwise
00105  */
00106 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_reference_target(git_reference *ref);
00107 
00108 /**
00109  * Get the type of a reference
00110  *
00111  * Either direct (GIT_REF_OID) or symbolic (GIT_REF_SYMBOLIC)
00112  *
00113  * @param ref The reference
00114  * @return the type
00115  */
00116 GIT_EXTERN(git_rtype) git_reference_type(git_reference *ref);
00117 
00118 /**
00119  * Get the full name of a reference
00120  *
00121  * @param ref The reference
00122  * @return the full name for the ref
00123  */
00124 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_reference_name(git_reference *ref);
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * Resolve a symbolic reference 
00128  *
00129  * Thie method iteratively peels a symbolic reference
00130  * until it resolves to a direct reference to an OID.
00131  *
00132  * If a direct reference is passed as an argument,
00133  * that reference is returned immediately
00134  *
00135  * @param resolved_ref Pointer to the peeled reference
00136  * @param ref The reference
00137  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00138  */
00139 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_resolve(git_reference **resolved_ref, git_reference *ref);
00140 
00141 /**
00142  * Get the repository where a reference resides
00143  *
00144  * @param ref The reference
00145  * @return a pointer to the repo
00146  */
00147 GIT_EXTERN(git_repository *) git_reference_owner(git_reference *ref);
00148 
00149 /**
00150  * Set the symbolic target of a reference.
00151  *
00152  * The reference must be a symbolic reference, otherwise
00153  * this method will fail.
00154  *
00155  * The reference will be automatically updated in
00156  * memory and on disk.
00157  *
00158  * @param ref The reference
00159  * @param target The new target for the reference
00160  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00161  */
00162 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_set_target(git_reference *ref, const char *target);
00163 
00164 /**
00165  * Set the OID target of a reference.
00166  *
00167  * The reference must be a direct reference, otherwise
00168  * this method will fail.
00169  *
00170  * The reference will be automatically updated in
00171  * memory and on disk.
00172  *
00173  * @param ref The reference
00174  * @param target The new target OID for the reference
00175  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00176  */
00177 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_set_oid(git_reference *ref, const git_oid *id);
00178 
00179 /**
00180  * Rename an existing reference
00181  *
00182  * This method works for both direct and symbolic references.
00183  * The new name will be checked for validity and may be
00184  * modified into a normalized form.
00185  *
00186  * The refernece will be immediately renamed in-memory
00187  * and on disk.
00188  *
00189  */
00190 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_rename(git_reference *ref, const char *new_name);
00191 
00192 /**
00193  * Delete an existing reference
00194  *
00195  * This method works for both direct and symbolic references.
00196  *
00197  * The reference will be immediately removed on disk and from
00198  * memory. The given reference pointer will no longer be valid.
00199  *
00200  */
00201 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_delete(git_reference *ref);
00202 
00203 /**
00204  * Pack all the loose references in the repository
00205  *
00206  * This method will load into the cache all the loose
00207  * references on the repository and update the 
00208  * `packed-refs` file with them.
00209  *
00210  * Once the `packed-refs` file has been written properly,
00211  * the loose references will be removed from disk.
00212  *
00213  * WARNING: calling this method may invalidate any existing
00214  * references previously loaded on the cache.
00215  *
00216  * @param repo Repository where the loose refs will be packed
00217  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00218  */
00219 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_packall(git_repository *repo);
00220 
00221 /**
00222  * Fill a list with all the references that can be found
00223  * in a repository.
00224  *
00225  * The listed references may be filtered by type, or using
00226  * a bitwise OR of several types. Use the magic value
00227  * `GIT_REF_LISTALL` to obtain all references, including
00228  * packed ones.
00229  *
00230  * The string array will be filled with the names of all
00231  * references; these values are owned by the user and
00232  * should be free'd manually when no longer needed, using
00233  * `git_strarray_free`.
00234  *
00235  * @param array Pointer to a git_strarray structure where
00236  *              the reference names will be stored
00237  * @param repo Repository where to find the refs
00238  * @param list_flags Filtering flags for the reference
00239  *              listing.
00240  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00241  */
00242 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_listall(git_strarray *array, git_repository *repo, unsigned int list_flags);
00243 
00244 
00245 /**
00246  * List all the references in the repository, calling a custom
00247  * callback for each one.
00248  *
00249  * The listed references may be filtered by type, or using
00250  * a bitwise OR of several types. Use the magic value
00251  * `GIT_REF_LISTALL` to obtain all references, including
00252  * packed ones.
00253  *
00254  * The `callback` function will be called for each of the references
00255  * in the repository, and will receive the name of the reference and
00256  * the `payload` value passed to this method.
00257  *
00258  * @param repo Repository where to find the refs
00259  * @param list_flags Filtering flags for the reference
00260  *              listing.
00261  * @param callback Function which will be called for every listed ref
00262  * @param payload Additional data to pass to the callback
00263  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00264  */
00265 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_listcb(git_repository *repo, unsigned int list_flags, int (*callback)(const char *, void *), void *payload);
00266 
00267 /** @} */
00268 GIT_END_DECL
00269 #endif
